lexUnit.name: expect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard as likely to happen, do, or be the case.

sentence.text: We expected that the most intelligent horses would get the empty bucket off the top of the food in the shortest time .
But there is no a priori reason to expect that any one paradigm is perfect or even the best available .
We expect that this push will end the war .
I hoped she knew to expect that her kitchen would look like a nuclear test site when she returned .
She had never expected it would be so hard to pretend lack of interest when her very heart and soul were longing to demonstrate her love .
I expect I 'll be back by eleven or so . "
Cnut 's men had fought hard , and doubtless expected to be remunerated accordingly .
` Did you expect to find me quiescent , then ? "
` I did n't expect Hollywood to be like this .
He did n't expect it to be washed off again , either .
They had expected the Prime Minister to appoint a third woman to his Cabinet .
We naturally expect British Rail to attach the greatest importance to safety considerations .
As an author , I expect reviewers to be honest and objective .
No-one expects you to go by the book ; it 's not your speed . "
Charlie pushed it open slowly , expecting a volley of bullets to follow but the loudest sound they heard was the screech of the hinges .
I waited for a day or so , expecting some sort of national protest .
The UN Secretary-General Javier Pérez de Cuéllar confirmed on Nov. 18 that he expected the release of the five remaining Western hostages by Christmas .
Without Batty , Leeds have lost six of their last eight matches , and if he comes through tomorrow 's reserve team clash with Newcastle , he can expect a recall at Blackburn on Saturday .
` I expected my times at Marseille to be measured in years and months , not weeks and days .
No one seriously expects revolution in East Germany from below .
Everyone expects better results in the next quarter .
You ca n't expect ordinary people in this situation to live like hermits , and it would be unreasonable to expect Charles and Diana to live like hermits .
But on neither count could he expect a very sympathetic hearing in Washington .
Do not expect the world around you to change .
When he came over to me I fully expected a slap on my kisser , I being the known ring-leader .
We can not expect our competitors on mainland Europe to put up with such discrimination .
` I had n't expected all the containers in here to be emptied out , too ! "
It is too much to expect musicians to deliberately cast aside the fringe benefits of success .
I do n't expect you to actually read any .
I half expected him to " clown " a bit and not to be really interested , but he worked seriously and was a great asset to the group and to me in later discussion .
` I 'm expecting very important persons . "
` James MacDiarmid will be expecting us , so we will let him stew a bit .
` I was n't expecting visitors .
` Ah , yes , Mr Vass is expecting you , Mrs Howell . "
The new pop groups were expected by their record companies to construct their music as its own advertisement , as a video spot on MTV , Sky Channel , TV-am .
They are expected by friends and neighbours to follow the normal passages of grieving , yet often they are consumed with anger .
Julia said soothingly , ` Why should Canon Wheeler be expected by the police to know about keys ? "
A full hearing is expected by mid-April .
Negotiations were expected to be concluded by mid-1993 .
In general it is expected that the engineer shall be fair and reasonable in the way he or she administers the contract .
She was the one who was expected to liaise with civic authorities and heads of other churches .

Indo-Soviet trade , which had been increasing rapidly , was expected to grow further after the signing of a trade protocol worth Rs70,000 million in 1989 , a 35 per cent increase over the sum for 1988 .
We expect a lot more customers to take advantage of the price cuts . "
I expect Britain and the European Economic Community to be standing ready to support the elections and the democratic process in El Salvador .
Equally one might expect the full-time paid CAB worker , who normally eschews the middle-class volunteer , to cheer the broadening of the CAB volunteer base .
` Now you leave Yugoslavia and still expect the Yugoslav Army to protect you . "
As you 'd expect from a hotel of this calibre , the bedrooms are lavish and extremely comfortable .
Fines for illegal works to listed buildings are related to the financial benefit expected by the offender .
Their manager 's distress on hearing the draw could have something to do with the fact that Messiahs are not usually expected to rework old miracles .
An improvement is not expected until next summer .
` That 's the man I was expecting earlier , " said Fagin .
` You expect too much , " said Tuathal .
Shabbiness she had expected , but not dirt and this air of something disreputable lurking though unseen .

Instead of the cafe or the restaurant that he 'd expected , he found a narrow shop with a few uncontroversial-looking videos in the window display and a more extensive and X-rated stock of tapes and magazines inside .
“ It was n't something either of us expected , perhaps … ”
